channel.title: Errors on ThingsDB documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Errors on ThingsDB documentation

item.title: assert_err
item.description: Returns an error when an assertion has failed. This function does not generate a change. Function assert_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows assert_err(): assert_err(); Return value in JSON format

item.title: auth_err
item.description: Returns an error when authentication has failed. This function does not generate a change. Function auth_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows auth_err(): auth_err(); Return value in JSON format

item.title: bad_data_err
item.description: Returns an error when a request is malformed. This function does not generate a change. Function bad_data_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows bad_data_err(): bad_data_err(); Return value in JSON format

item.title: forbidden_err
item.description: Returns an error when the client or user is missing the required privileges. This function does not generate a change. Function forbidden_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows forbidden_err():

item.title: lookup_err
item.description: Returns an error when a requested resource is not found or when an index is out-of-range. This function does not generate a change. Function lookup_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows lookup_err():

item.title: max_quota_err
item.description: Returns an error when a quota limit is reached. This function does not generate a change. Function max_quota_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows max_quota_err(): max_quota_err(); Return value in JSON format

item.title: node_err
item.description: Returns an error when a node was not able to handle the request. This function does not generate a change. Function node_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows node_err():

item.title: num_arguments_err
item.description: Returns an error when a wrong number of arguments is given. This function does not generate a change. Function num_arguments_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows num_arguments_err(): num_arguments_err(); Return value in JSON format

item.title: operation_err
item.description: Returns an error when an operation is not valid within the current context. This function does not generate a change. Function operation_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows operation_err():

item.title: overflow_err
item.description: Returns an error when an attempt is made to create an integer value out of the supported 64Bit (signed) range. This function does not generate a change. Function overflow_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message).

item.title: syntax_err
item.description: Returns an error when the given ThingsDB code contains a syntax error. This function does not generate a change. Function syntax_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows syntax_err():

item.title: type_err
item.description: Returns an error when a given value is of the incorrect type. This function does not generate a change. Function type_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows type_err():

item.title: value_err
item.description: Returns an error when a given value has the correct type but contains invalid data. This function does not generate a change. Function value_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows value_err():

item.title: cancelled_err
item.description: Returns an error when an operation is cancelled before completion. Fox example by a time-out or stop of service. This function does not generate a change. Function cancelled_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message).

item.title: zero_div_err
item.description: Returns an error when an attempt is made to divide or take a modulo by zero. This function does not generate a change. Function zero_div_err([message]) Arguments Argument Type Description message str (optional) Alternative error message. Return value An error value (in a client response, an error value will be packed as a string value with the error message). Example This code shows zero_div_err():
